section.text: *NOTE: This section was created by temporary legislation that will expire on August 3, 2023.*

*NOTE: This section includes amendments by emergency legislation that will expire on July 23, 2023. To view the text of this section after the expiration of all emergency and temporary legislation, click this link: Permanent Version.*
section.heading: Eligibility.

para.text: The Mayor shall establish and publish eligibility and termination criteria for services and supports funded pursuant to [this chapter] within 30 days after April 24, 2023; provided, that the eligibility and termination criteria:
May include statutory, regulatory, or programmatic categories of immigration, means of entering the District, and length of time in the United States or the District;

Shall ensure individuals are provided with adequate written and oral notice when services are denied or terminated pursuant to the established eligibility criteria; provided, that individuals with limited or no English proficiency receive such notice in the individual's primary language; and
Shall be published online in English and Spanish.
No provision of this chapter shall be construed to create an entitlement (either direct or implied) on the part of any individual or family to any services and supports provided under this chapter.

section.codify:annotation: For temporary (225 days) creation of § 4-773.02, see § 102 of Migrant Services and Supports Temporary Amendment Act of 2022 (D.C. Law 24-234, Dec. 21, 2022, 69 DCR 13991).
For temporary (225 days) creation of this section, see § 102 of Migrant Services and Supports Temporary Amendment Act of 2022 (D.C. Law 24-234, Dec. 21, 2022, 69 DCR 13991).
